title: Lecture notes
text:
Lecture notes

Complete notes
Introduction
Chapter 1: Floating point arithmetic
Chapter 2: Interpolation and approximation
Chapter 3: Numerical integration
Chapter 4: Solving linear equations
Chapter 5: Solving nonlinear equations
Chapter 6: Calculating eigenvalues and eigenvectors
Chapter 7: Numerical integration of differential equations
Chapter 8: Numerical optimization
Appendix A: Linear algebra
Appendix B: Introduction to Julia
Appendix C: Chebyshev polynomials
Bibliography

title: Useful links
text:
Below are some useful videos to learn about Julia:

Intro to Julia tutorial (version 1.0) by Jane Herriman
Introductory notebooks to Julia.
The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Multiple Dispatch
More details on one of the strong points of Julia : “multiple dispatch”.

title: Credits
text:
Several parts of the course materials (slides, exercises, notebooks) were developed by members of the teaching team for the course Practical Scientific Computing at École des Ponts :

2023- : Jean-François Barthélémy (jean-francois.barthelemy@cerema.fr)
2025- : Louis Carillo (louis.carillo@enpc.fr)
2023, 2024 : Noé Blassel (noe.blassel@enpc.fr)
2023 : Shiva Darshan (shiva.darshan@enpc.fr)
2023 : Renato Spacek

The lecture notes were greatly improved thanks to contributions from Jean-François Barthélémy and Khoi Nguyen.
This website was built using Quarto and a design by Jean-François Barthélémy.

title: Numerical Analysis
text:
To install Julia download the latest version from here.




VSCode can be installed at this link.
The extension Julia can also be installed directly from VSCode.

title: Numerical Analysis
text:
Reference textbooks
The course is based on two books:

An Introduction to Numerical Analysis, by Süli and Mayers.
Numerical Mathematics, by Quarteroni.

title: Numerical Analysis
text:
Practical information

Lectures on Monday and Wednesday from 15:30 to 16:45
Recitations on Monday and Wednesday from 16:50 to 17:35
Office hour on Monday from 14:30 to 15:30 in Room 606
Midterm evaluation on November 5th
Final exam on December 12th
